name: 13ft-ladder
tagline: A self-hosted web service to retrieve full article content from URLs without ads or paywalls
description: 13ft is an open-source, self-hosted web service designed as a replacement for 12ft.io. It allows you to input a URL and retrieve the article’s full content—bypassing ads and paywalls, by emulating a GoogleBot crawl to fetch what search engines see. Built in Python (Flask) and easily deployable via Docker, it’s geared toward users who want more control over accessing web content and hosting their own instance. The project is MIT-licensed, with support for custom host/port setups, and has a community of users and contributors.

features.title: Paywall Bypass
features.description: Access full article content without subscriptions or ads. Read freely without restrictions

features.title: Self-Hosted
features.description: Run on your own server for complete data privacy. Your reading, your infrastructure

features.title: Simple Usage
features.description: Just paste any URL to retrieve the complete article text. One-click access to content

features.title: Search and Filter
features.description: Mimics search engine crawlers to access public content. Leverages existing web standards

features.title: Docker Support
features.description: Docker support enables quick installation and setup. Running in minutes

features.title: Customizable
features.description: Configure host and port settings to match your needs. Flexible server options

features.title: Open Source
features.description: MIT licensed with active community contributions. Free and transparent
